Name: Mirror with a sleeve in the form of a statuette
Description: This bronze mirror is composed of two parts: a heart-shaped disc and a sleeve in the form of a female silhouette surmounted by a capital of falling umbels. The young naked woman wears a long wig which falls down onto the chest making the object difficult to identify. The legs are gripped one against the other. The piece, which was purchased in Cairo in 1906, dates from the New Kingdom.
